result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian J. Mentch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-False Representation >$2500-$5000, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: probation extends for an additional 12 months

Defendant Brian J. Mentch in court.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State advises DE still owes restitution per agent.  State requests probation be extended for one year to pay off the restitution.  Court extends the probation for an additional 12 months or sooner, if paid in full.  Agent, Aaron Polenske via telephone after the hearing had been conducted, court informs agent of status of hearing.
Probation review hearing on October 24, 2017 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Brian J. Mentch in court.  Kevin R. Calkins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State states appearances and status.  Court notes what DOC shows he still owes.  DE states he paid $400 last Wednesday and states he'll start paying $200/week beginning next week.  Parties agree discharge date if 10/29/2017.  Court suggests we come back on 10/24/17 and see where payments stand.  Probation review hearing scheduled for October 24, 2017 at 11:30 am.
